title: Login Not Authenticating
body: Oh boy, sometimes your game crashes and then from that point on you can't log in... isn't that the pits. I don't know if it's an issue with my internet as I was able to play at a friend's house on the same laptop, but the patching keeps failing. If anyone has any insight, I'd be happy to hear it. Thanks!

replies.body: Ahhhh it sounds like you're getting caught in a forced repatch loop. Sometimes the automated repatch isn't quite able to get those files fixed up, so we need to try a more manual approach. Give our [**Hextech Repair Tool**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367-Automated-Troubleshooting-Hextech-Repair-Tool) a go, but make sure you run it with the option **force repatch** turned on. Let me know how that goes!

"An unexpected error occurred while logging in. Please try again. If this issue persists, contact support at support.riotgames.com" 
This is the message I've been getting since the game crashed. I've been in contact with a Riot employee trying to get to the bottom of it, but it hasn't happened yet. Just figured if I could get some insight from the people. I'm able to get to the game through a VPN but I've only got so much data per month with that.

Danny - could you run a trace route against 104.160.131.1 ?  I'm curious if you are getting routed through Denver. There is a node that's down in the Denver area that is owned by Comcast that most that are having this exact error message, are being routed through. 

The VPN connection lets you get around that but it's as you said, limited data and in most cases, a monthly fee.

Yuuuup, that's exactly what I'm getting. Any idea how to remedy it?

Use a VPN to re-route your connection so you don't go through Denver. That's really the only way. Riot's tech team is aware of it but there hasn't been any update in several days. Maybe one of the mods can chime in.
